subject: Pedals upgrade
description_text:
Hello,

I have a set of Simsonn Pro Pedal Plus and I want to upgrade the control box's software in order to use it in Simsonn Manager. The pedals are recognised in the Simsonn Manager app but it says: "THE VERSION IS TOO OLD TO USE".

I did find on reddit this post:

*The SIMSONN MANAGER can be used to upgrade the firmware of the Simsonn Pro Pedal Control Box to version 1.8.0. The Pro Pedals can then be calibrated normally using the SIMSONN MANAGER calibration software. Manual upgrade steps:*

*1. Download the SIMSONN MANAGER software and make sure it is the latest version 2.0.6 (shown in the bottom right corner). Below are links to the software and software calibration videos:
http://download.simsonn.com/simsonnmanager
Then, press the ‘Upgrade Button’ on the Master Box to enter upgrade mode.
2. Reconnect USB: Unplug the current USB cable and reconnect the USB cable to ensure that the device has been properly reconnected and the pedal enters upgrade mode.
3. Manually upgrade the firmware: Find the SIMSONN Manager\env\firmware\pedal folder from the software storage directory, locate the corresponding firmware file, and start the upgrade.
4. Wait for the upgrade to complete and please Note: during the upgrade process, don't disconnect, turn off the power or exit the programme, otherwise the control box will not work! In the case of Pro X pedals, the LEDs on the pedals will turn off, indicating that the light upgrade is in progress.
5. When the upgrade is complete, manually release the upgrade button on the control box.
6. To return to normal operating mode: Finally, unplug and reconnect.*

You do mention to 'press the ‘Upgrade Button’ on the Master Box to enter upgrade mode'. Can you please point me to where is this button located? I have the control box attached in the picture.

* I also did find a tab in the app (SETTINGS - UPDATE - MANUAL UPDATE, PEDAL than I did select the pedals folder and the version 'plus 1.8.0.'). After I select the version, a bar starts and says upgrading but it does nothing. Only disconnects my pedals from PC and I have to reconnect them in order to work and again it says 'THE VERSION IS TOO OLD TO USE'.

Can you please help me a bit on how to upgrade the software? Thanks!

conversations.body_text: Hi Albert Stoicescu, Please check the old version of the software—version 1703 cannot be upgraded, but version 1713 can be.

So if my control box has version 1703 it cannot be upgraded? How do I check which version I have? The pedals were bought in October 2024.

On Tue, 24 Jun 2025 at 17:49, support@simsonn.com
Hi Albert Stoicescu, You can download SimConfigPedals V4 from our official website to check the device version.

Hello. I did check and the control box *software* is *1713.* What are the next steps to upgrade to the new version to use the Simsonn Manager app?

On Wed, Jun 25, 2025 at 11:01 AM support@simsonn.com

Hi Albert Stoicescu, Have you successfully completed the upgrade? Please share a screenshot of the software so I can check. If SIMSONN Manager 2.0.8 shows “SIMSONN Plus” as connected, that means the upgrade was successful. You can then proceed to calibrate the pedals, set the minimum and maximum deadzones, and bind the pedals in your game to start playing.

Hello, I asked you have to perform the update because I did not manage to make it. The Simsonn Manager show Pedals are connected but the version is too old( picture 1), then I press settings, update, manual update, select pedals and the version 1.8.0, and instantly say UPGRADE COMPLETE but it is not happening the update.
